intro: Barbosella circinata, commonly known as the spiral leaf barbosella, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the dry season. Barbosella circinata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments.
